de.unisiegen.tpml.core.util
Interface Environment<S,E>

All Known Subinterfaces:
Store, TypeEnvironment
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractEnvironment, DefaultStore, DefaultTypeEnvironment
public interface Environment<S,E>

Generic base interface for all environments used while proving properties about programs. For example the type environment used in the type checker inherits this interface, and the store used in the big and small step interpreters also inherits this interface.

Version:
$Rev: 277 $
Author:
Benedikt Meurer
See Also:
AbstractEnvironment

Method Summary
 boolean containsSymbol(S symbol)
          Returns true if this environment contains an entry for the specified symbol.
 E get(S symbol)
          Returns the entry that is stored for the given symbol in this environment.
 Enumeration<S> symbols()
          Returns an enumeration of the symbols within this store, in the reverse order of the allocation.
 

Method Detail

containsSymbol

boolean containsSymbol(S symbol)
Returns true if this environment contains an entry for the specified symbol. Otherwise false is returned. The meaning of the symbol depends on the actual environment. For example, for stores, this is a Location, and for the the type environment, this is an identifier (a String).

Parameters:
symbol - the symbol to check.
Returns:
true if the environment contains an entry for the symbol, otherwise false.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if symbol is null.
See Also:
#get(S)

get

E get(S symbol)
Returns the entry that is stored for the given symbol in this environment. Throws a NoSuchElementException if the symbol is invalid for this environment.

Parameters:
symbol - the symbol for which to return the entry. See the description of the #containsSymbol(S) method for details about the symbol.
Returns:
the entry for the symbol.
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if the symbol is invalid for the environment.
NullPointerException - if symbol is null.
See Also:
#containsSymbol(S)

symbols

Enumeration<S> symbols()
Returns an enumeration of the symbols within this store, in the reverse order of the allocation. That is, the last inserted symbol is returned first.

Returns:
an enumeration of the symbols. See the description of the #containsSymbol(S) method for details about the symbols.
See Also:
#get(S)
